name: sonarlint-vscode
description: Linter to detect & fix coding issues locally in JS/TS, Python, PHP, Java, C, C++, Go, IaC. Use with SonarQube & SonarCloud for optimal team performance.

^[^:]+:[^:]+$.markdownDescription: Property names are rule keys in the form: `repo:key`

level.markdownDescription: When set to `off`, disable the rule. When set to `on`, enable the rule.

parameters.markdownDescription: Rule parameters. See rule description for accepted parameters. E.g `{ "intParam": "123" }`.

sonarlint.connectedMode.servers.deprecationMessage: The setting is deprecated. Use `sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sonarqube` or `sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sonarcloud` instead.

serverId.description: A unique identifier for this server connection. Will be referenced from `#sonarlint.connectedMode.project#`

serverUrl.description: URL of the server. Use https://sonarcloud.io for SonarCloud.

token.description: Token generated from My Account>Security in SonarQube/SonarCloud

sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sona.markdownDescription: In connected mode, SonarLint applies the SonarQube quality profile to the local analysis and synchronizes the issue status and other analysis settings. Please find the documentation [here](https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarlint/vs-code/team-features/connected-mode/)

connectionId.description: A unique identifier for this connection to be used as a reference in `#sonarlint.connectedMode.project#`. Only needed if you plan to use multiple connections to SonarQube/SonarCloud.

token.description: Token generated from 'My Account>Security' in SonarQube

disableNotifications.description: SonarLint will show notifications for bound projects when there are new issues assigned to you, or when the quality gate status changed. Set to false to disable all notifications for projects bound to this connection.

sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sona.markdownDescription: In connected mode, SonarLint applies the SonarQube quality profile to the local analysis and synchronizes the issue status and other analysis settings. Please find the documentation [here](https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarlint/vs-code/team-features/connected-mode/)

connectionId.description: A unique identifier for this connection to be used as a reference in `#sonarlint.connectedMode.project#`. Only needed if you plan to use multiple connections to SonarQube/SonarCloud.

organizationKey.description: A SonarCloud organization key. If you want to bind different projects that are in different organizations, simply declare multiple connections.

token.description: Token generated from 'My Account>Security' in SonarCloud

disableNotifications.description: SonarLint will show notifications for bound projects when there are new issues assigned to you, or when the quality gate status changed. Set to false to disable all notifications for projects bound to this connection.

sonarlint.connectedMode.project.markdownDescription:
Bind the current workspace folder to a [SonarQube](https://sonarqube.org) or [SonarCloud](https://sonarcloud.io) project. Requires connection details to be defined in the setting `#sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sonarqube#` or `#sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sonarcloud#`.

Binding a workspace folder to a project allows to use the same rules and configuration that are defined in the server, as well as issue suppressions.

Example:

    "sonarlint.connectedMode.project": {
      "projectKey": "my_project"
    }

Specify the `connectionId` only if you have defined multiple connections.

serverId.description: Identifier of the server connection declared in `#sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sonarqube#` or `#sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sonarcloud#`

projectKey.description: Key of the project in SonarQube/SonarCloud

connectionId.description: Identifier of the server connection declared in `#sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sonarqube#` or `#sonarlint.connectedMode.connections.sonarcloud#`

projectKey.description: Key of the project in SonarQube/SonarCloud (can be found on project homepage)

sonarlint.pathToNodeExecutable.markdownDescription:
Path to a Node.js executable (14.17.0 or more recent) used to analyze JavaScript and TypeScript code. 
On Windows, backslashes must be escaped, e.g. `C:\\Program Files\\NodeJS\\14-lts\\bin\\node.exe`

sonarlint.pathToCompileCommands.markdownDescription: Path to the active compilation database, e.g. `C:\\Repos\\MyProject\\compile_commands.json`

sonarlint.testFilePattern.markdownDescription: Files whose name match this [glob pattern](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/io/fileOps.html#glob) are considered as test files by analyzers. Most rules are *not* evaluated on test files. Example: `**/test/**,**/*test*,**/*Test*`

sonarlint.analysisExcludesStandalone.markdownDescription: Files whose name match this [glob pattern](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/io/fileOps.html#glob) will not be processed by analyzers. When SonarLint is connected to SonarQube or SonarCloud this property will be ignored and server exclusion settings will be applied. No rules are evaluated on excluded files. Example: `**/lib/**,**/*generated*`

sonarlint.ls.javaHome.markdownDescription:
Path to a Java Runtime Environment (11 or more recent) used to launch the SonarLint Language Server.
* On Windows, backslashes must be escaped, e.g. `C:\\Program Files\\Java\\jdk-11.0.12+7` 
* On macOS, this path should include the `/Contents/Home` directory, e.g `/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk-11.0.12+7.jdk/Contents/Home`

sonarlint.ls.vmargs.markdownDescription: Extra JVM arguments used to launch the SonarLint Language Server. e.g. `-Xmx1024m`

sonarlint.output.showVerboseLogs.description: Enable verbose log level in the SonarLint output.

sonarlint.output.showAnalyzerLogs.description: Show analyzer's logs in the SonarLint output.

sonarlint.analyzerProperties.markdownDescription: Extra properties that could be passed to the code analyzers. Only for advanced use cases.

sonarlint.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VS Code and the SonarLint language server.

sonarlint.disableTelemetry.markdownDescription: Disable sending anonymous usage statistics to SonarSource. Click [here](https://github.com/SonarSource/sonarlint-vscode/blob/master/telemetry-sample.md) to see a sample of the data that are collected.

sonarlint.focusOnNewCode.markdownDescription: Set SonarLint focus to new code. [Learn how](https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarlint/vs-code/using-sonarlint/investigating-issues/#focusing-on-new-code) to deliver clean code with Clean as You Code.

commands.title: Update all project bindings to SonarQube/SonarCloud
Reopen Local Issues for current file
Configure the compilation database for C and C++ analysis
Bind all workspace folders to SonarQube or SonarCloud

viewsWelcome.contents:
No locations to show.
Use "Show all locations" code action from a SonarLint issue.

No SonarQube/SonarCloud connections found. [Learn more](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=SonarSource.sonarlint-vscode#connected-mode).
[Add SonarQube Connection](command:SonarLint.ConnectToSonarQube)
[Add SonarCloud Connection](command:SonarLint.ConnectToSonarCloud)

Please ensure a connection to SonarQube 9.7+ or SonarCloud is set up. Detected Security Hotspots will be displayed here. [Learn More](https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarlint/vs-code/using-sonarlint/security-hotspots).
 Using the In Whole Folder feature may consume excessive resources depending on the size of your project. Please check the [documentation](https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarlint/vs-code/using-sonarlint/security-hotspots/#reporting-security-hotspots-in-the-whole-folder) for recommendations to minimize the impact of a full project analysis.

walkthroughs.title: Welcome to SonarLint!
walkthroughs.description: Your Clean Code journey starts here.

steps.title: $(rocket) New to SonarLint? See it in action
steps.description:
SonarLint for VSCode supports analysis of 15+ languages including JS/TS, Java, Python, CSS/HTML, C, C++, and [more](https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarlint/vs-code/using-sonarlint/rules). SonarLint detects issues in all files **open** in the editor.

The best way to get started is to see it in action!
[Open Sample File](command:SonarLint.OpenSample)

steps.title: $(book) Learn more about issues
steps.description:
Check the [Problems view](command:workbench.panel.markers.view.focus): SonarLint has found something $(warning).
Right-click on the issue found by SonarLint.
Open the rule description: SonarLint clearly explains why this is an issue.
For certain rules and issues, SonarLint will suggest available Quick Fixes.

steps.title: $(link) Connect with your team
steps.description:
Use the same Clean Code standards as your team by using SonarLint in Connected Mode with [SonarQube](https://www.sonarsource.com/products/sonarqube/) or [SonarCloud](https://www.sonarsource.com/products/sonarcloud/).
**Already using SonarQube or SonarCloud?** Check out the Connected Mode view to set up the connection.
[Set up Connection](command:SonarLint.ConnectedMode.focus)

steps.title: $(comment-discussion) Share feedback or ask for help
steps.description:
You suspect your code has issues but don't see any problems detected by SonarLint? [Enable verbose logging](command:SonarLint.EnableVerboseLogs) and check the output in the SonarLint Output window
[Check Output](command:SonarLint.ShowSonarLintOutput)

You'd like to learn more about SonarLint, or give us feedback? Check out the [Help and Feedback view](command:SonarLint.HelpAndFeedback.focus)

view/item/context.title: Add Project Binding
view/item/context.when: view == SonarLint.ConnectedMode && viewItem == sonarcloudConnection || viewItem == sonarqubeConnection

view/item/context.title: Remove
view/item/context.when: view == SonarLint.ConnectedMode && viewItem == sonarcloudConnection || viewItem == sonarqubeConnection

view/item/context.title: Clear Highlighting
view/item/context.when: view == SonarLint.SecurityHotspots && viewItem == newHotspotItem || viewItem == knownHotspotItem || viewItem == remoteHotspotItem

colors.description: Background color for highlighted secondary locations of SonarLint issues
Text color for secondary location index of SonarLint issues
Background color for secondary location index of SonarLint issues
Text color for active secondary location index of SonarLint issues
Background color for active secondary location index of SonarLint issues
